cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSW of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW and expected to slow, then turn NW – tracking along or just north of eastern-central Cuba Friday and approaching the Florida Keys / extreme South Florida on Saturday before entering the eastern Gulf of Mexico.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: vicinity of the Florida Keys / extreme South Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches in effect for portions of Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, and several eastern/central Cuban provinces
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Bahamas, northern coast of Cuba, Florida Keys, south and southwest Florida, and later the northeastern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (3–5 in. with isolated 8 in. forecast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph gusts) are possible Saturday with a peak 15 % probability; sustained gales are not yet likely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected on the Atlantic side; any rise should remain below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands beginning Friday and peaking Saturday–Sunday could total 3–5 inches with locally higher amounts, producing urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the Southeast Florida coast; brief squalls may temporarily reduce visibility and affect port operations.
